info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cabarrus, southeastern Iredell, north central Mecklenburg and southwestern Rowan Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Huntersville, or 4 miles northwest of Coddle Creek Reservoir. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huntersville, Kannapolis, Cornelius, Mooresville, Davidson, Enochville, Coddle Creek Reservoir and Lake Norman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
